favourite.article: I don't quite understand the meaning of this song.
Lovely hymn And yes mingling is the way. Praise the Lord, saints!
I really enjoy this song... In the center of our being is a certain spot created to contain the Lord until, by His flooding and His flowing He will all our being fill. Yes mingling is the way.
Thank the Lord for meetings with the saints where we get refocused on the mingling.
Praise You Lord for Your intention!! That is to be with us Lord Jesus!! To be with humanity. Yes, mingling is the WAY!!

Now I would like to say a further word on the enjoyment of God in the house of God as seen in Book One of the Psalms, comprising Psalms 1â€”41. A number of items of David's enjoyment are good, but many of them are objective and not available. David said that he lifted up his hands unto the innermost sanctuary (Psa. 28:2). This is altogether objective. David also said that those in God's temple all said, "Glory!" (29:9). If God is merely the glory outside of us, He has nothing to do with us. Objective glory does not help us, but our being subjectively mingled with the Triune God works. The chorus of Hymns, #1199 says, "Mingle, mingle, hallelujah...Yes, mingling is the way!" In God's New Testament economy, subjective mingling is the way.
Source: Life-study of Psalms, chapter 13.
